 void checkPostTerminationChar()
          Tests an arbitrary selection of characters to ensure that a character following a termination character (such as a full stop) is only defined to be a valid "post termination" character such as a closing parenthesis or closing quotation mark when it matches one of the characters within the postTerminators RegEx Pattern.

processIndex

public void processIndex()
                  throws java.io.IOException
Tests an arbitrary handful of index words to ensure no word can be added to the list of index words and phrases more than once, that case conversion is executed and the list is correctly sorted. The index file used defines; Xylophone, explosion, EXPLOSION, love, hate, Love, Hate, biscuit, Internet. Expected: *Ordered words Vector has six elements. *Xylophone to be final element in array and lowercase.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

checkWordSideClean

public void checkWordSideClean()
Tests an arbitrary selection of characters to ensure that a word is only reported as "clean" if both the left and right characters either side of it are not alphabetical characters. Expected; *Tests containing no alphabetical characters in BOTH left and right to assertTrue. *Tests containing alphabetical characters in EITHER left and right to assertFalse.

checkPostTerminationChar

public void checkPostTerminationChar()
Tests an arbitrary selection of characters to ensure that a character following a termination character (such as a full stop) is only defined to be a valid "post termination" character such as a closing parenthesis or closing quotation mark when it matches one of the characters within the postTerminators RegEx Pattern. Expected; *Closing parenthesis and closing quotations to assertTrue. *Other characters such as alphanumeric to assertFalse. *Opening parenthesis should also assertFalse.

lineSentenceTerminated

public void lineSentenceTerminated()
Tests an arbitrary selection of lines to ensure that lines are only defined as terminated when they contain a valid termination character contained by the terminators RegEx Pattern. Expected; *Lines containing the full stop, question mark or exclamation mark to return the index of the terminating character in the line. *Lines not containing one of these permitting characters to return -1.
